decks.notes: This deck utilizes a low-cost, aggressive strategy with cards like Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe to quickly ramp up damage. It also includes card draw spells like Consider and Opt to help maintain momentum. The key strategy revolves around quickly bringing back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard by casting multiple spells in one turn, providing a constant stream of pressure on the opponent. Furthermore, cards like Picklock Prankster and Treasure Cruise offer additional resource generation and card advantage to keep the pressure on.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, card draw, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage and eventually winning the game through powerful threats like The Wandering Emperor or March of Otherworldly Light. The inclusion of the companion Kaheera, the Orphanguard provides an additional source of value and synergizes well with the deck's overall game plan. By controlling the game and out-valuing the opponent, this deck aims to secure victory.

The main concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to put constant pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Duress and Thoughtseize. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, while also leveraging the value of Mutavault and Blightstep Pathway. With a mix of powerful threats and efficient removal, this deck looks to quickly end the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to use efficient creatures and disruption spells to apply early pressure on the opponent and control the board. By casting creatures like Archon of Emeria, Skyclave Apparition, and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats and generating card advantage through Collected Company. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruption spells, the deck looks to close out games quickly while maintaining a strong board presence.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to establish an early board presence with efficient creatures like Novice Inspector and Thraben Inspector, followed by pumping up the team with cards like Venerated Loxodon and Warden of the Inner Sky. Portable Hole helps control the opponent's board while cards like Gleeful Demolition and Cosmogrand Zenith provide additional reach and removal options. The deck aims to apply pressure quickly and overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize, utilizing a mix of creatures, removal, and pump effects to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the combo between Greasefang and Parhelion II to generate powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The deck focuses on protecting its creatures with cards like Fleeting Spirit and Sheltered by Ghosts while disrupting the opponent's strategy with Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. By assembling the pieces of the combo and keeping the battlefield under control, the deck aims to secure victory in the Pioneer 1 vs 1 format through a strong and synergistic game plan.

This Aggro Red Deck Wins archetype focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck prioritizes dealing damage efficiently and consistently, with a mixture of powerful creatures like Robber of the Rich and Kumano Faces Kakkazan, supported by various burn and direct damage spells like Lightning Strike and Burst Lightning. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game, taking advantage of its low curve and high damage potential to secure a victory before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering spells, removing threats, and drawing cards to outvalue the opponent. It also uses a variety of planeswalkers and creatures to generate card advantage and win conditions. The key strategy is to maintain board control, disrupt the opponent's plans, and overwhelm them with powerful spells and resilient threats. It aims to stall the game out until it can establish a dominant position and close out the game with a mix of evasion and removal. Overall, the deck aims to outplay the opponent through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

The main concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to put pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and disrupt their game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize. The deck also utilizes versatile removal spells such as Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to control the board. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse provides additional value and potential game-ending threats. Overall, the deck aims to maintain a fast and aggressive tempo while disrupting the opponent's strategy to secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent, utilizing efficient creatures like Monstrous Rage, Kumano Faces Kakkazan, and Emberheart Challenger. The deck also includes burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to control the board and clear the way for attacking. With cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Questing Druid to provide additional support and synergy with the overall aggressive strategy, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and relentless attacks while maintaining board presence.

The main focus of this deck is to establish control over the game by disrupting your opponent's strategy with a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption effects. This is achieved by using cards like Thoughtseize, Negate, and Fatal Push to disrupt your opponent's plays, while also utilizing cards like Shark Typhoon and Narset, Parter of Veils to generate card advantage and maintain control of the game. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistency and support the spells in the deck.

This UW Control deck focuses on manipulating the board state and countering opponent's spells to ultimately control the game. The deck includes powerful control cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Dovin's Veto, along with removal spells like Supreme Verdict and Portable Hole. The goal is to outmaneuver the opponent by using card advantage and disruption to eventually win the game. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as the companion adds even more control options and flexibility to the deck.

The deck focuses on utilizing the synergy between Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II to create a powerful combo strategy. The goal is to protect the combo pieces with cards like Sheltered by Ghosts and Seasoned Hallowblade, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The deck's mana base includes various dual lands to ensure consistent and efficient mana production for the combo to be executed smoothly. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its key cards quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a devastating combo.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly generate value through sacrificing creatures with cards like Witch's Oven and Deadly Dispute, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay. The deck also aims to utilize cards like Grisly Salvage and Scavenger's Talent to fill up the graveyard for Ygra, Eater of All and Dredger's Insight. Overall, the deck focuses on aggressive creature plays, graveyard synergies, and disrupting the opponent's strategy in a Pioneer 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By playing low-cost creatures like Heartfire Hero and Emberheart Challenger, along with cards like Burst Lightning and Lightning Strike, you can deal damage early and often. Utilizing cards like Monstrous Rage and Reckless Rage allow you to push through opposing blockers and clear the way for your creatures to attack. With a focus on fast plays and constant pressure, this deck aims to win the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board by disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Moon-Circuit Hacker. The deck aims to maintain a strong tempo by combining disruptive spells with evasive threats, allowing it to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Nowhere to Run and Enduring Curiosity provide additional disruption and card advantage to further disrupt the opponent's game plan.
